page.title: 05BLACKBURN ROYAL INFIRMARY.
page.content: {Blackburn Royal Infirmary}was first opened in{1865}but there have been {extensions}built in{1965}and{1980}to increase the number of beds & improve services.It costs{Â£14.5 million}to run each year.The head of administration is{Mr.Goss,}& he told us there are{395 beds for patients &{1500}staff to care for them and all outpatients.The{7} {operating theatres}are fully equipped, 1for eyes,1for ears,nose & throats & 5 for general use.Hospitals are{costly} to run.Each patients{food}costs{Â£3.15} each week,{Â£40,000}is spent on{bedding & telephone calls cost{Â£110,000}each year.{Mr.Goss}believes that{in the {future}the{quality}of Health Care depends on the{amount of research carried out,but Health Care should improve further with the greater use of{computer controlled}machinery to diagnose and help treat illnesses.
